title: TiKV panic when running br backup due to "called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value"
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
```
[root@tc-tikv-0 /]# /tikv-server -V
TiKV
Release Version:   7.6.0
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   b8858b4d4939cc43aff1b6d0b465b744a42110b9
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v7.6.0
UTC Build Time:    2024-01-15 07:53:16
Rust Version:      rustc 1.76.0-nightly (06e02d5b2 2023-12-09)
Enable Features:   pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure trace-async-tasks openssl-vendored
Profile:           dist_release
```

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
K8S

### Steps to reproduce
- A TiDB cluster with 20 TiKV nodes (16c64g)
- Run br restore to restore a backup for 500k tables, and restore failed due to https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/50477
- Run br backup to backup the cluster (parameters: --concurrency=256)

### What did you expect?
- Backup should succeed
- 
### What did happened?
